Classification.Classification: Actinopteri (ray-finned fishes) > Perciformes/Zoarcoidei (Eelpouts and pricklebacks) > Zoarcidae (Eelpouts) > Zoarcinae
Classification.Etymology: Zoarces: Greek, zoarkes, -es = that gives life . More on authors: Bloch & Schneider.

sectionData.Environment: Marine; brackish; demersal; oceanodromous ; depth range 0 - 388 m . Temperate; ? - 10°C ; 63°N - 37°N, 80°W - 43°W
sectionData.Distribution: Northwest Atlantic: Labrador, Canada to Delaware, USA.
sectionData.Biology: Benthic; feeds on worms, crustaceans, molluscs, sea squirts, sea urchins and fishes .
sectionData.Life cycle: Eggs are laid in gelatinous masses guarded by one or both parents until hatching . However, more recent evidence suggests that care is provided by the female alone .
